qas.question: In terms of finance, when being ruled by the English, where did Burma stand ?

answers.text: Under British administration, Myanmar was the second-wealthiest country in South-East Asia.

qas.question: What was Burma's greatest export during that time of English rule ?
What did Myanmar do that made it know to be one of the originals in a particular finance producing endeavor ?

answers.text: Burma began exporting crude oil in 1853, making it one of the earliest petroleum producers in the world.

qas.question: What wood product was produced primarily in Myanmar during British rule ?
What notable quality made Burma stand out from other South East Asian countries ?

context: <a0_0>Under British administration, Myanmar was the second-wealthiest country in South-East Asia.<a0_0/> It had been the world's largest exporter of <a1_0>rice<a1_0/>. Myanmar also had a wealth of natural and labour resources. British <a2_0>Burma began exporting crude oil in 1853, making it one of the earliest petroleum producers in the world.<a2_0/> It produced <a3_0>75% of the world's teak<a3_0/> and had <a4_0>a highly literate population<a4_0/>. The wealth was however, mainly concentrated in the hands of Europeans. In 1930s, agricultural production fell dramatically as international rice prices declined, and did not recover for several decades.
